original: Tell me about your wife.

translated: En signant le traité de Tripoli en 1796, notre second Président John Adams écrivit : "Les États-Unis n'ont en eux-mêmes aucun caractère d'inimitié à l'encontre des lois, de la religion ou de la tranquillité des Musulmans.

original: I don't have a sword.
translated: Je n'ai pas d'épée.

original: He struck me in the face with his fist.
translated: Il m'a mis un coup de poing au visage.

original: I like skipping rocks.
translated: J'aime m'adonner au ricochet.

original: Tom is three years older than you.
translated: Tom est trois ans plus vieux que vous.

original: Her days are numbered.
translated: Ses jours sont comptés.

original: Who's going to drive?
translated: Qui va conduire ?

original: They abandoned their homeland.
translated: Ils ont abandonné leur terre natale.

original: Should we intervene?
translated: Devrions-nous intervenir ?

original: I am afraid I cannot help you.
translated: Je crains de ne pas pouvoir vous aider.

original: She promised to marry him.
translated: Elle promit de l'épouser.

original: He didn't get caught.
translated: Il ne s'est pas fait prendre.

original: I should come, too.
translated: Je devrais venir, aussi.

original: Are there two windows in your room?
translated: Y a-t-il deux fenêtres dans ta chambre ?

original: I want to know the whole story.
translated: Je veux connaître toute l'histoire.

original: You took the wrong key.
translated: Vous vous êtes trompé de clé.

original: Tom will wash the dishes.
translated: Tom fera la vaisselle.

original: Do you really want to help?

original: Ziri looked.
translated: Ziri regarda.

original: I love to go to the movies.
translated: J’adore aller au cinéma.

original: I don't share your point of view.
translated: Je ne partage pas votre point de vue.

original: We will know the truth before long.
translated: Avant peu nous connaîtrons la vérité.

original: I'm not going to see you again.
translated: Je ne vais pas te revoir.

original: Why don't you mind your own business?
translated: Pourquoi ne t'occupes-tu pas de tes oignons ?

original: The uprising was brutally suppressed.
translated: Le soulèvement a été brutalement réprimé.

original: I was wrongfully punished.
translated: J'ai été injustement puni.

original: Tom has a beard.
translated: Tom a une barbe.

original: The weather was lenient.
translated: Le temps était clément.

original: To be honest, I'm not so sure either.
translated: Pour être honnête, je n'en suis pas si sûre non plus.

original: What will you have?
translated: Que choisis-tu ?

original: They come from the same town.
translated: Elles viennent de la même ville.

original: Be serious.
translated: Soyez sérieuses !

original: I will deal with her myself.
translated: Je vais m'en charger en personne.

original: You tried to stop Tom from doing that, didn't you?
translated: Vous avez essayé d'empêcher Tom de faire ça, n'est-ce pas ?

original: The capital of Italy is Rome.
translated: La capitale de l'Italie est Rome.

original: That is old news.
translated: On le sait déjà.

original: I will marry you.
translated: Je vous épouserai.

original: This is a tree in the spring.
translated: C'est un arbre au printemps.

original: Tom doesn't yet know whether he can go or not.
translated: Tom ne sait pas encore s'il peut y aller ou non.

original: I'd like to pay you back.
translated: J'aimerais te rembourser.

original: Try not to laugh.
translated: Essayez de ne pas rire.

original: He will succeed without fail.
translated: Il réussira sans coup férir.

original: This explanation doesn't mean anything!
translated: Cette explication n'a aucun sens !

original: Won't you go shopping with me?
translated: Ne veux-tu pas venir faire des courses avec moi ?

original: I'm resourceful.
translated: Je suis pleine de ressources.

original: He is eager to go there.
translated: Il est impatient d'y aller.

original: I was your mother's first boyfriend.
translated: J'étais le premier petit ami de ta mère.

original: What do you think he did?
translated: Que crois-tu qu'il a fait ?

original: She kept walking about the room.
translated: Elle continuait à marcher dans la pièce.

original: I have four sisters and one brother.
translated: J'ai quatre sœurs et un frère.

original: I have to go upstairs.
translated: Je dois monter.

original: Did you already do that?
translated: T'as déjà fait ça ?

original: They like wine.
translated: Ils aiment le vin.

original: You didn't buy that, did you?
translated: Vous n'avez pas acheté cela, n'est-ce pas ?

original: I think we're related.
translated: Je pense que nous sommes apparentées.

original: I bought Tom a banjo for Christmas.
translated: J'ai acheté un banjo à Tom pour Noël.

original: What do you really think?
translated: Que pensez-vous vraiment ?

original: Anyway, if you want to know more about my country, I'll send you a letter when I get home.
translated: Dans tous les cas, si vous voulez en savoir plus sur mon pays, je vous enverrai une lettre quand je serai chez moi.

original: Staying home isn't fun.
translated: Rester chez soi n'a rien d'amusant.

original: Why didn't they say something?
translated: Pourquoi n'ont-ils rien dit?

original: There's not enough food for all of us.
translated: Il n'y a pas assez de nourriture pour nous tous.

original: He spoke well of her son.
translated: Il dit du bien de son fils.

original: A year consists of four seasons.
translated: Une année se compose de quatre saisons.

original: I congratulated him on his success.
translated: Je l'ai félicité pour son succès.

original: What's the harm in trying?
translated: Quel mal y a-t-il à essayer ?

original: Mary will never be able to do it by herself.
translated: Mary ne sera jamais capable de le faire par elle-même.

original: You've spent time with Marie.
translated: Tu as passé du temps avec Marie.

original: I've always considered you a close friend.
translated: Je t'ai toujours considérée comme une amie intime.

original: The investment firm tricked customers into buying worthless stock.
translated: La société d'investissements a dupé des clients en leur faisant acheter des actions sans valeur.

original: You may as well keep it a secret.
translated: Vous pouvez tout aussi bien le garder secret.

original: My pen has run out of ink! Can I borrow your pen?
translated: Mon stylo n'a plus d'encre ! Pouvez-vous me prêter votre stylo ?

original: There is a small pond in our garden.
translated: Il y a un petit étang dans notre jardin.

original: You owe me big-time.
translated: Tu as une dette énorme envers moi.

original: Greece is an old country.
translated: La Grèce est un vieux pays.

original: Do you know how to use it?
translated: Sais-tu comment l'utiliser ?

original: Don't work yourself to death.
translated: Ne vous tuez pas à la tâche.

original: The movie was good.
translated: Le film était bon.

original: I have high blood pressure, so I need to stay away from salt.
translated: J'ai une tension élevée, donc je dois éviter le sel.

original: You should go and have a look yourself.
translated: Tu devrais aller voir par toi-même.

original: He's an Italian teacher.
translated: Il est professeur d'italien.

original: You should only count on yourself--but even then, not too much.
translated: Il ne faut compter que sur soi-même. Et encore, pas beaucoup.

original: Why don't you invite her here?
translated: Pourquoi ne l'invites-tu pas ici ?

original: I would buy it if it weren't so expensive.
translated: Je l'achèterais si ce n'était pas aussi cher.

original: I'm a little tired.
translated: Je suis un peu fatigué.

original: I honor that.
translated: J'honore cela.

original: He scolded her.
translated: Il l'a grondée.

original: Stop taunting me.
translated: Arrête de te moquer de moi.

original: I had forgotten how beautiful you are.
translated: J'avais oublié à quel point tu es belle.

original: He can't help you.
translated: Il ne peut pas t'aider.

original: This book looks interesting.
translated: Ce livre semble intéressant.

original: Don't just stand there! Help me clean it up!
translated: Ne restez pas plantées là ! Aidez-moi à le nettoyer !

original: Your music pleases me very much.
translated: Ta musique me plait beaucoup.

original: You can't leave us like this.
translated: Vous ne pouvez pas nous laisser comme ça.

original: I can't make myself understood in French.
translated: Je ne peux pas me faire comprendre en français.

original: He's three years older than me.
translated: Il est trois ans plus vieux que moi.

original: Okay. Drive safely.
translated: D'accord. Conduis prudemment.

original: The Universe is limitless.
translated: L'Univers est illimité.

original: I walk in the night down the wrong path, not knowing where I come from, unsure of where I'm going.
translated: Je marche dans la nuit par un chemin mauvais, ignorant d'où je viens, incertain où je vais.

original: I called you.
translated: Je vous ai appelé.

original: No one was responsible for the great Wall Street crash. No one engineered the speculation that preceded it. Both were the product of free choice and decision of hundreds of thousands of individuals.
translated: Personne n'est responsable du crash de Wall Street. Personne n'a organisé la spéculation qui l'a précédée. Tous deux sont le fruit du libre choix et de la décision de centaines de milliers d'individus.

original: They were all there.
translated: Elles étaient toutes là.

original: My shift is over.
translated: Mon service est terminé.

original: I'm responsible for this.
translated: Je suis responsable de ceci.

original: I think she is good at dancing.
translated: Je pense qu'elle est bonne en danse.

original: Did you sleep well?
translated: As-tu bien dormi ?

original: Do you mind if I park here?
translated: Vois-tu un inconvénient à ce que je me gare ici ?

original: My sister hit the jackpot!
translated: Ma sœur a touché le jackpot !

original: Father always says, "Do your best."
translated: Père dit toujours : « Fais de ton mieux. »

original: I will go to New York next week.
translated: J'irai à New York la semaine prochaine.

original: Tom can't speak French either.
translated: Tom ne parle pas français non plus.

original: My wife is afraid to drive my new car.
translated: Ma femme a peur de conduire ma nouvelle voiture.

original: Little did I dream of my success in this business.
translated: Je songeais à peine à réussir dans cette affaire.

original: Are you French or English?
translated: Êtes-vous français ou anglais ?

original: I don't want to sing.
translated: Je n'ai pas envie de chanter.

original: I'm hungry. I'm going downstairs for something to eat.
translated: J'ai faim. Je vais descendre pour manger quelque chose.

original: Syria will not return to what it was.
translated: La Syrie ne sera plus ce qu'elle était.

original: The sky is covered with clouds today.
translated: Le ciel est couvert aujourd'hui.

original: Do you know how to paint?
translated: Tu sais peindre ?

original: I can't help but laugh when I think about that.
translated: Je ne peux m'empêcher de rire quand je pense à ça.

original: I guess what I've said isn't all that clear, but that's the only way I can explain it.
translated: J'imagine que ce que j'ai dit n'est pas si clair que ça, mais c'est la seule façon dont je peux l'expliquer.

original: How much does this umbrella cost?
translated: Quel est le prix de ce parapluie ?

original: He is no more foolish than you are.
translated: Il n'est pas plus bête que tu ne l'es.

original: I just finished cleaning the garage.
translated: Je viens de finir de nettoyer le garage.

original: Do I look dead to you?
translated: Ai-je l'air morte, selon toi ?

original: I never go on holiday without cleaning my apartment.
translated: Je ne pars jamais en vacances sans avoir nettoyé mon appartement.

original: Tom should be back here by 2:30.
translated: Tom devrait être de retour pour 2h30.

original: He will come back at four.
translated: Il sera de retour à 4 heures.

original: It's 10 a.m.
translated: Il est dix heures du matin.

original: Happy reading!
translated: Bonne lecture !

original: Let's pretend we didn't hear that.
translated: Faisons comme si nous n'avions pas entendu cela !

original: I checked the date.
translated: J'ai vérifié la date.

original: Do you have your keys?
translated: As-tu tes clefs?

original: Mary broke her right arm.
translated: Mary s'est cassé le bras droit.

original: He's very good at maths.
translated: Il est très bon en maths.

original: What you said is completely correct.
translated: Ce que tu as dit est tout à fait correct.

original: I have a possible explanation for that.
translated: J'ai une explication possible pour cela.

original: The table in that room is very nice.
translated: La table dans cette pièce est très jolie.

original: I'm sorry I didn't keep my promise.
translated: Je suis désolé de ne pas avoir tenu ma promesse.

original: Did you do it?
translated: L'as-tu fait ?

original: Why did you guys break up?
translated: Pourquoi avez-vous rompu, les mecs ?

original: I don't have a choice. I have to do it.
translated: Je n'ai pas le choix. Je dois le faire.

original: Amsterdam is amazing!
translated: Amsterdam est magnifique !

original: I don't feel like partying.
translated: Je ne suis pas d'humeur à faire la fête.

original: You can't hurt me any more than you already have.
translated: Tu ne peux pas me blesser davantage que tu l'as déjà fait.

original: He is said to be able to speak without using notes.
translated: On dit qu'il est capable de parler sans notes.

original: Come by later, I have something for you.
translated: Passe plus tard, j'ai quelque chose pour toi !

original: I put the horse back in the stable yesterday.
translated: J'ai remis le cheval dans l'étable, hier.

original: Prince William is second in line to the English throne.
translated: Le prince Guillaume est le second en ligne de succession au trône d'Angleterre.

original: I've never been asked for anything like this.
translated: On ne m'a jamais demandé quelque chose comme cela.

original: The girl let the bird go.
translated: La fille laissa l'oiseau s'envoler.

original: I explained the rule to him.
translated: Je lui expliquai la règle.

original: Wonderful!
translated: Magnifique !

original: My profession? Poet and humbug.
translated: Ma profession ? Poète et fumiste.

original: Can you read and write French?
translated: Savez-vous lire et écrire le français ?

original: I wish I had more time to spend with friends.
translated: J'aimerais avoir davantage de temps à consacrer à mes amis.

original: The bird is dead.
translated: L'oiseau est mort.

original: Do you have a Mason jar?
translated: As-tu un pot Mason ?

original: I'm not used to being laughed at.
translated: Je ne suis pas habitué à ce qu'on se moque de moi.

original: Both of my parents have passed away.
translated: Mes parents sont tous deux décédés.

original: Tom tried to persuade Mary to drive.
translated: Tom a essayé de persuader Mary de conduire.

original: She didn't know she had married a monster.
translated: Elle ne savait pas qu'elle avait épousé un monstre.

original: She asked him questions.
translated: Elle lui a posé des questions.

original: Attached is the tentative agenda.
translated: En annexe se trouve un ordre du jour provisoire.

original: What a lousy day!
translated: Quelle journée pourrie !

original: Lately he's been rebelling against his parents.
translated: Ces derniers temps, il se rebelle contre ses parents.

original: I don't think I should do that by myself.
translated: Je ne pense pas que je devrais faire ça tout seul.

original: Will the government raise the consumption tax soon?
translated: Est-ce que le gouvernement prévoie d'augmenter les taxes sur la consommation d'ici peu ?

original: I did some shopping for Christmas on my way home.
translated: J'ai fait quelques courses pour Noël sur le chemin du retour.

original: It was after a meeting in America that he decided to write a book for non-scientists.
translated: C'était après une réunion en Amérique qu'il décida d'écrire un livre pour les non-initiés.

original: Did you notice that she left the house?
translated: As-tu remarqué qu'elle a quitté la maison ?

original: Tom is a maniac.
translated: Tom est un maniaque.

original: Since he was feeling sick, he stayed in bed.
translated: Comme il se sentait malade, il resta au lit.

original: The same force spread over a smaller area will produce more pressure.
translated: La même force appliquée à une surface plus petite produira davantage de pression.

original: You've taken the trash cans out.
translated: Tu as sorti les poubelles.

original: Tom's thoughts wandered.
translated: Les pensées de Tom vagabondaient.

original: You lost, didn't you?
translated: Tu as perdu, n'est-ce pas ?

original: The girl sitting over there is Nancy.
translated: La fille qui est assise juste là-bas, c'est Nancy.

original: The new tunnel will link Great Britain and France.
translated: Le nouveau tunnel reliera la Grande-Bretagne et la France.

original: Do you like driving?
translated: Aimez-vous conduire ?

original: She came late as usual.
translated: Elle arriva en retard comme d'habitude.

original: Where is my newspaper?
translated: Où est mon journal ?

original: I'll call you back later.
translated: Je te rappelle plus tard.

original: May I speak to you for a moment?
translated: Puis-je te parler un moment ?

original: How did you get so strong?
translated: Comment es-tu devenu si fort ?

original: This car is mine.
translated: C'est ma voiture.

original: Nobody knew what to do.
translated: Personne ne savait quoi faire.

original: I started to cry too.
translated: Je me mis également à pleurer.

original: What was the outcome?
translated: Quelle en fut l'issue ?

original: You're overqualified for this job.
translated: Tu es surqualifié pour ce travail.

original: You look tired.
translated: On dirait que tu es fatigué.

original: I want to be an astronaut.
translated: Je veux être cosmonaute.

original: Do you like going to school?
translated: Aimez-vous aller à l'école ?

original: Don't be too sensitive to criticism.
translated: Ne sois pas trop sensible aux critiques.

original: I did everything you asked.
translated: J'ai fait tout ce que vous avez demandé.

original: The ATM swallowed my card.
translated: Le distributeur de billets a avalé ma carte.

original: You can stay here as long as you keep quiet.
translated: Vous pouvez rester ici tant que vous gardez votre calme.

original: I think about her a lot.
translated: Je pense beaucoup à elle.

original: Nobody is paying attention to Tom.
translated: Personne ne fait attention à Tom.

original: I can tell you're angry.
translated: Je peux dire que tu es énervé.

original: Benson and Holmes analyzed the psychological effect of artificial insemination on parents.
translated: Benson et Holmes ont analysé les effets psychologiques de l'insémination artificielle chez les parents.

original: I believe in Ken.
translated: Je crois Ken.

original: You're sad.
translated: Tu es triste.

original: I will be staying for two nights.
translated: Je resterai deux nuits.

original: She's self-employed.
translated: Elle est indépendante.

original: I needed help.
translated: Il me fallut de l'aide.

original: Would you like a glass of orange juice with your breakfast?
translated: Voudriez-vous un verre de jus d'orange avec votre petit-déjeuner ?

original: That dress really becomes him.
translated: Cette robe lui va vraiment bien.

original: He forgave me breaking my promise.
translated: Il m'a pardonné de n'avoir pas tenu ma promesse.

original: I feel smart... Pity... It's just a feeling...
translated: Je me sens intelligent... Dommage... Ce n'est qu'une impression...

original: Gina's sheer coldness attracted scads of men with low self-esteem.
translated: La froideur absolue de Gina attirait une foule d'hommes souffrant d'un déficit d'amour-propre.

original: Do you like squash soup?
translated: Vous aimez la soupe de courge ?

original: Are you there?
translated: T’es là ?

original: Why is she so silent?
translated: Pourquoi est-elle si silencieuse ?

original: Could you please take the dog out for a walk?
translated: Tu peux sortir le chien, s'il te plaît ?

original: You might want to think about this a little longer.
translated: Tu devrais réfléchir à ça un peu plus longtemps.

original: I found my bicycle gone.
translated: J'ai vu que mon vélo avait disparu.

original: The letter was written by hand.
translated: La lettre était manuscrite.

original: I want to drive to his house in my car.
translated: Je veux aller chez lui dans ma voiture.

original: As for me, I don't have any comments.
translated: En ce qui me concerne, je n'ai pas de remarques.

original: I hope you have a great day!
translated: Je te souhaite une bonne journée !

original: This soup is exquisite.
translated: Cette soupe est exquise.

original: I'm so in love!
translated: Je suis tellement amoureuse !

original: The negotiation is off.
translated: La négociation est terminée.

original: Was Tom happy?
translated: Tom était-il heureux ?

original: In U.S. bakeries, a "baker's dozen" is 13, not 12.
translated: Dans les boulangeries américaines, une "douzaine du boulanger" est 13 et non 12.

original: Who ended up paying the bill?
translated: Qui a fini par payer la note?

original: That was my finger.
translated: C'était mon doigt.

original: What did you eat for lunch today?
translated: Qu’avez-vous mangé pour le déjeuner aujourd'hui ?

original: Sami swapped good grades with street gangs.
translated: Sami a échangé de bonnes notes avec des gangs de rue.

original: Did you see the news?
translated: As-tu vu la nouvelle ?

original: What is your blood type?
translated: Quel est votre groupe sanguin ?

original: That automobile was going very fast.
translated: Cette voiture roulait très vite.

original: It was not easy to get a lot of money in a short time.
translated: Il n'était pas simple de gagner beaucoup d'argent en peu de temps.

original: Since my mother was sick, I couldn't go there.
translated: Comme ma mère était malade, je n'ai pas pu m'y rendre.

original: Don't try to make me angry.
translated: N'essayez pas de me mettre en colère.

original: Would you like to come over for dinner after work on Monday?
translated: Souhaiteriez-vous venir dîner après le travail lundi ?

original: She was supposed to attend the party with him.
translated: Elle était supposée paraître à la fête avec lui.

original: He made a gesture of impatience.
translated: Il fit un geste d'impatience.

original: I don't like being controlled.
translated: Je n'apprécie pas d'être contrôlé.

original: Several roads are closed.
translated: Plusieurs routes sont fermées.

original: We need more data.
translated: Nous avons besoin de plus de données.

original: Tom acknowledges that he was defeated.
translated: Thomas admet qu'il a été battu.

original: What's Tom's dream school?
translated: Quelle est l'école rêvée de Tom ?

original: He was framed on a murder charge.
translated: Il s'est fait incriminer de meurtre.

original: I'll take my revenge on him at all costs tomorrow.
translated: Je prendrai ma revanche sur lui à tout prix demain.

original: You want to get out of here, don't you?
translated: Vous voulez sortir d'ici, non ?

original: I tried unsuccessfully to persuade her.
translated: J'ai essayé en vain de la persuader.

original: That's all I can tell you right now.
translated: C'est tout ce que je peux vous dire à cet instant.

original: He beat the shit out of me.
translated: Il m'a collée une pilée.

original: I have seen that somewhere.
translated: Je l'ai vu quelque part.

original: I haven't seen you for years.
translated: Je ne t'ai pas vu depuis des années.

original: He is what we call a walking dictionary.
translated: Il est ce qu'on appelle un dictionnaire ambulant.

original: According to the radio, it will snow tomorrow.
translated: Selon la radio, il va neiger demain.

original: Slave revolts interfered with the Middle Passage.
translated: Les révoltes d'esclaves perturbaient le Passage du milieu.

original: Well then, what are we waiting for?
translated: Alors, qu'attendons-nous ?

original: Please turn out the light so that I can sleep.
translated: Éteignez la lumière que je puisse dormir, je vous prie.

original: You're the smartest man I know.
translated: Tu es l'homme le plus intelligent que je connaisse.

original: What do you like to eat?
translated: Qu'est-ce que tu aimes manger ?

original: You're to blame for the accident.
translated: Vous êtes responsable de l'accident.

original: I'm not the same person I was when you first met me.
translated: Je ne suis pas la même personne que lorsque vous m'avez rencontré.

original: I'm asking you as a friend.
translated: Je te le demande en tant qu'amie.

original: Greetings from France!
translated: Salutations de la France !

original: His overall was covered with paint-stains.
translated: Sa combinaison était couverte de taches de peinture.

original: I barely know anything about you.
translated: Je n'en sais guère à votre sujet.

original: Tom persuaded her into going to the movies with him.
translated: Tom l'a persuadée d'aller voir un film avec lui.

original: In your entire life, you never have seen such a thing.
translated: De ta vie, tu n'as vu pareille chose.

original: I like reading.
translated: J'aime lire.

original: It's very romantic!
translated: C'est très romantique !

original: How do you become rich?
translated: Comment devenir riche ?

original: You're such a cute boy.
translated: Tu es un garçon tellement mignon !

original: From childhood I dreamed of being a pastry cook.
translated: Devenir pâtissier était un rêve d'enfant.

original: Most students agree with the proposal, and made a list of arguments in favour of it.
translated: La plupart des étudiants sont d'accord avec la proposition et ont dressé une liste des arguments en sa faveur.

original: He's got a face like a month of wet Sundays.
translated: Il fait une tête d'enterrement.

original: I know Tom is a genius.
translated: Je sais que Tom est un génie.

original: John has a car from Japan.
translated: John a une voiture venant du Japon.

original: Did you have a good time?
translated: Est-ce que tu t'es amusé ?

original: I wonder if the teacher works here.
translated: Je me demande si le professeur travaille ici.

original: He is taller than any other boy.
translated: Il est plus grand que les autres garçons.

original: He never wanted to help his mates.
translated: Il n'a jamais voulu aider ses camarades.

original: It isn't difficult to do that.
translated: Ce n'est pas difficile à faire.

original: Didn't Tom go to Mary's house?
translated: Tom n’est-il pas allé chez Marie ?

original: That's exactly what I expected.

original: He has a good memory.

original: I want to go to Australia.

original: I slept a lot.

original: Our team did not reach the playoffs this year.

original: The landlord told him to leave because he hadn't paid his rent.
translated: Le propriétaire lui a demandé de partir car il n'avait pas payé son loyer.

original: The girl got her fingers caught in the door.
translated: La fille s'est coincée les doigts dans la porte.

original: I found a pair of sunglasses by the swimming pool.
translated: J'ai trouvé une paire de lunettes de soleil aux abords de la piscine.

original: She almost drowned.

original: We'll need a head hunting agency to find the right man for this executive position.

original: He is a strange person.

original: I'm worried about him, too.

original: I am the God of Bethel, where thou didst anoint the stone, and make a vow to me. Now therefore arise, and go out of this land, and return into thy native country.
translated: Je suis le Dieu de Béthel, où tu as oint un monument, où tu m’as fait un vœu. Maintenant, lève-toi, sors de ce pays, et retourne au pays de ta naissance.

original: Argh! My computer froze up again.
translated: Argl ! Mon ordinateur a encore planté !

translated: J'aimerais que tu puisses rester un peu plus longtemps.

original: You're speaking too quietly for me to hear what you're saying.
translated: Vous parlez trop doucement pour que je puisse entendre ce que vous dites.

original: I'm hungry.

original: The real purpose of the law was enshrouded in layers of obscure terminology.
translated: Le but réel de la loi était dissimulé sous des couches de terminologie obscure.

original: We'll catch you.

original: We're getting divorced.
translated: Nous sommes en train de divorcer.

original: Get in the bathroom.

original: Forward!

original: They'll be thirsty.

original: He looks like a clever boy.

original: Tom never talks about his feelings.
translated: Tom ne parle jamais de ses sentiments.

original: My father often washes the dishes.
translated: Mon père fait souvent la vaisselle.

original: I saw the picture you took of that fish.
translated: J'ai vu la photo que tu as prise de ce poisson.

original: He made for the door and tried to escape.
translated: Il se dirigea vers la porte et essaya de s'enfuir.

original: What languages are you learning?

original: Take a closer look.

original: I read a letter.

original: My father is rich.

original: There is a red rose in the vase.

original: He is nothing more than a dreamer.

original: There is nothing to do but apologize.

original: I just wanted to be happy.

original: I walked up the hill.

original: Hold your tongue, or you'll be punished.

original: In all probability, we shall arrive before them.

original: I don't have the nerve to watch it.

original: You probably can't do that.

original: You should listen to his advice.

original: My screw gun is making weird noises.

original: You're very attractive.

original: We remind you that our terms are 60 days net.
translated: Nous vous rappelons que nos conditions sont à 60 jours fermes.

original: Did you call the police?

original: You'll be asked why you want to be a teacher.
translated: On te demandera pourquoi tu veux être enseignante.

original: Be bold!

original: God, give us peace!
translated: Dieu, donne-nous la paix !

original: I wanted to make her happy.
translated: J'avais envie de la rendre heureuse.

original: I bought her a clock.
translated: Je lui ai acheté une horloge.

original: I've got to get back home by midnight.
translated: Je dois être rentrée chez moi pour minuit.

original: I was sharpening the knives.

original: It's not anything serious.

original: I'm not sure.

original: She went shopping with her friend.
translated: Elle alla faire des emplettes avec son ami.

original: She did not cry.

original: The dog was hit by a car.
translated: Le chien fut heurté par une voiture.

original: We couldn't go out because of the rain.
translated: Nous n'avons pas pu sortir à cause de la pluie.

original: The winter grew colder and colder; he was obliged to swim about on the water to keep it from freezing, but every night the space on which he swam became smaller and smaller. At length it froze so hard that the ice in the water crackled as he moved, and the duckling had to paddle with his legs as well as he could, to keep the space from closing up. He became exhausted at last, and lay still and helpless, frozen fast in the ice.
translated: L'hiver était devenu de plus en plus froid; il était obligé de nager en rond dans l'eau pour éviter de geler, mais chaque nuit, l'espace dans lequel il nageait devenait de plus en plus petit. A la longue, il gelait si fort que la glace craquait à chacun de ses mouvements, et le caneton devait bouger ses jambes autant qu'il le pouvait afin d'éviter que l'espace ne se ferme. Il était épuisé à la fin, et se coucha calmement et sans espoir, rapidement congelé dans la glace.

original: Our baseball diamond is very small.
translated: Notre terrain de baseball est très petit.

original: People change. There's not much you can do about it.
translated: Les gens changent. Il n'y a pas grand chose à y faire.

original: They are siblings.

original: Have you finished reading the novel?
translated: Avez-vous fini de lire le roman ?

original: Evil isn't born, it is taught.

original: I'll look at it very carefully.

original: I knew that Tom did that.

original: Feel for the pockets of your raincoat.
translated: Cherchez dans vos poches d'imperméable.

original: "What are you eating?" "Hare fricassee."
translated: « Que mangez-vous ? » « De la fricassée de lièvre. »

original: They are wrong.

original: This tramway connects the city centre with the railway station.

original: You seem to be making progress.

original: This tree is remarkable!

original: Tom will wait as long as you tell him to.
translated: Tom attendra aussi longtemps que vous le lui demanderez.

original: In my grandmother's lifetime, both telephones and computers have become commonplace.
translated: Dans la vie de ma grand-mère, les téléphones et les ordinateurs sont devenus banals.

original: It was a dream.

original: I just don't think I can do it.

original: Don't broach that topic in her presence.

original: No one will buy this stuff.

original: She's unfit for the job.

original: She has international renown as a painter.

original: I feel like getting some fresh air.

original: They agreed to start early.

original: They speak German fluently.

original: Could I have some more tea?

original: She lives paycheck to paycheck.

original: Where have they gone?

original: Don't talk!

original: I thought I knew all your secrets.

original: I like coffee better.

original: I wish we'd met earlier.

original: He is a bit of talkative.

original: He joined the English club.
translated: Il a rejoint le club anglais.

original: I didn't know what was happening.

original: She fell ill a week ago.

translated: Le nouveau film de Veber, « Le Dîner de cons », comme son film célèbre « La Cage aux folles », est très amusant.

original: How much money do you have?

original: She wants to live in the city.

original: My shoes are bigger than yours.

original: His father worked on the railway.

original: Don't shoot!

original: I love my yellow pullover very much.

original: No one is talking.

original: This report is not perfect.

original: You don't stand a chance against her.

original: I love to live.

original: French is difficult.

original: I arrived later than usual.

original: I think he will succeed.

original: What's making that noise?

original: You should get your eyes examined.
translated: Tu devrais faire examiner tes yeux.

original: He's painting his house.
translated: Il est en train de peindre sa maison.

original: He has a strong sense of responsibility.

original: Cinderella had two evil stepsisters.

original: It isn't fair at all.

original: I was told that I should see a doctor.

original: I fell in love with her.

original: I was really young when I met you.

original: The cost of building the new hospital was considerably higher than first estimated.
translated: Le coût de la construction du nouvel hôpital était très supérieur à l'estimation initiale.

original: Mary is the best student in school.
translated: Marie est la meilleure élève de l'école.

original: My brother is good at mathematics.

original: I'm always happy.

original: Why is that red light blinking?

original: My plan covers unlimited calls to landlines, but not mobiles.
translated: Mon contrat couvre les appels illimités vers les lignes fixes, mais pas vers les mobiles.

original: They hired me to help them.
translated: Elles m'ont engagé pour les aider.

original: The police are investigating my brother for the murder, but they're barking up the wrong tree.
translated: La police enquête sur mon frère pour le meurtre, mais ils se trompent de crèmerie.

original: I would like to rent a bike, please.
translated: Je voudrais louer un vélo, s'il vous plaît.

original: Amsterdam is famous for its canals.

original: Would you like to go with me?

original: One can get accustomed to anything.
translated: On peut s'habituer à tout.

original: Would you care for more coffee?

original: She warmed herself by the fire.
translated: Elle se réchauffait près du feu.

original: You're irresponsible.
translated: Tu es irresponsable.

original: You grabbed my ass!

translated: La situation en Afghanistan démontre les objectifs de l'Amérique, et notre besoin de travailler ensemble.

original: What are we doing for lunch?

original: Maybe it was a cat.

original: Don't forget about me.

translated: Tom a laissé son parapluie dans la classe.

original: He got the first prize in the contest.
translated: Il gagna le premier prix de la compétition.

original: Why are you so quiet?
translated: Pourquoi êtes-vous si silencieux ?

original: Say it in Berber.

original: I have lived in Boston since 1995.
translated: Je vis à Boston depuis 1995.

original: If I were you, I wouldn't do such a thing.

original: I'm 1.9 meters tall.
translated: Je mesure 1 m 90.

original: I almost caught the ball.

original: The girl who works at the bakery is cute.

translated: L'avion s'envola au delà de notre champs de vision.

original: Let's end this debate.
translated: Terminons ce débat.

original: They'll be afraid.
translated: Ils auront peur.

original: Are there taxis around here?
translated: Y a-t-il des taxis par ici ?

original: I want something sweet to eat.
translated: Je veux quelque chose de sucré à manger.

original: You are impatient.
translated: Tu es impatient.

original: Tom decided to risk it all.
translated: Tom a décidé de tout risquer.

original: She may have argued with him, but I don't think she could have hit him.
translated: Elle s'est peut-être disputée avec lui, mais je ne pense pas qu'elle aurait pu le frapper.

original: They shouldn't let children swim in that river.
translated: Ils ne devraient pas laisser les enfants nager dans cette rivière.

original: The defense has requested bail.
translated: La défense a demandé une mise en liberté sous caution.

original: The dog can bring back a stick.
translated: Le chien peut ramener un bâtonnet.

original: The problem will eventually solve itself.
translated: Le problème finira par se résoudre de lui-même.

original: I could've gone last week.
translated: J'aurais pu y aller la semaine dernière.

original: We had lunch.
translated: Nous avons déjeuné.

original: We're prepared.
translated: Nous sommes prêts.

original: Love, Jon.
translated: Je vous embrasse, Jon.

original: I've told the police.
translated: Je l'ai dit à la police.

original: He lost both his parents at an early age.
translated: Il perdit ses deux parents à un jeune âge.

original: He heard a noise from the kitchen.
translated: Il a entendu un bruit de la cuisine.

original: We need to get you to a hospital.
translated: Nous devons t'emmener à l'hôpital.

original: The bellows are not working.
translated: La sonnette ne fonctionne pas.

original: He had come back from China.
translated: Il est revenu de Chine.

original: The dictionary is an invaluable tool for learning languages.
translated: Quand on étudie les langues, le dictionnaire est d'une aide précieuse.

original: I'll tell you how to get to Tom's house.
translated: Je vais te dire comment arriver chez Tom.

original: There is nothing more to say!
translated: Il n'y a rien de plus à dire.

original: The museum has other musical artifacts going back to the beginning of sound recording. These include wax cylinders, created by Thomas Edison in 1877.
translated: Le musée possède d'autres objets musicaux remontant aux débuts de l'enregistrement sonore. On trouve notamment des cylindres phonographiques, conçus par Thomas Edison en 1877.

original: But why would I help you?
translated: Mais pourquoi vous aiderais-je ?

original: I love to prepare food.
translated: J'adore préparer à manger.

original: Try not to worry.
translated: Essayez de ne pas vous en faire !

original: Most Swiss citizens speak two or three languages.
translated: La plupart des Suisses parlent deux ou trois langues.

original: He came back two days after.
translated: Il revint deux jours après.

original: It's better to wait for the police to arrive.
translated: Il vaut mieux attendre que la police arrive.

original: I'm the only one who can do that.
translated: Je suis la seule qui peut faire cela.

original: Let him in.
translated: Laissez-le entrer.

original: I think that's the best option.
translated: Je pense que c'est la meilleure option.

original: You have lipstick on your cheek.
translated: Tu as du rouge-à-lèvres sur la joue.

original: We've endured three wars.
translated: Nous avons enduré trois guerres.

original: Snails are hermaphrodites.
translated: Les escargots sont hermaphrodites.

original: You'll ruin everything.
translated: Tu vas tout foutre en l'air.

original: He asked for a beer.
translated: Il demanda une bière.

original: We all live in the same dormitory.
translated: Nous vivons tous dans la même résidence étudiante.

original: A thief believes everybody steals.
translated: Un voleur croit que tout le monde vole.

original: I think I'm in trouble.
translated: Je pense que j'ai des ennuis.

original: From where is he?
translated: D'où est-il ?

original: I think we're safe here.
translated: Je pense que nous sommes en sécurité, ici.

original: Open your books to page one hundred.
translated: Ouvrez vos livres à la page cent.

original: Move the child away from the fire!
translated: Éloigne le gosse du feu !

original: She's there already?
translated: Est-elle déjà là ?

original: She considered his offer carefully.
translated: Elle considéra sa proposition avec soin.

original: Can you ski?
translated: Sais-tu faire du ski ?

original: She had her navel pierced.
translated: Elle s'est fait percer le nombril.

original: I must help her at any cost.
translated: Je dois l'aider à tout prix.

original: You must send the answer to the letter right away.
translated: Vous devez envoyer immédiatement une réponse à cette lettre.

original: Mary offers a bouquet of flowers to her sister.
translated: Marie offre un bouquet de fleurs à sa sœur.

original: This is a difficult situation.
translated: C'est une situation difficile.

original: What did you just say?
translated: Que venez-vous de dire ?

original: Tom is sick.
translated: Tom est malade.

original: My sister is an English teacher.
translated: Ma sœur est professeur d'anglais.

original: Most of the students already understand this.
translated: La plupart des étudiants comprennent déjà ceci.

original: I can't believe you let this happen.
translated: Je n'arrive pas à croire que tu aies permis que cela se produise.

original: Tom and I like the same kind of music.
translated: Tom et moi aimons le même genre de musique.

original: You must not leave right now.
translated: Tu ne dois pas partir maintenant.

original: If wealth was more evenly distributed, there would be less poverty.
translated: Si la richesse était distribuée de manière plus équitable, il y aurait moins de pauvreté.

original: These pieces of furniture are not for sale.
translated: Ces meubles ne sont pas à vendre.

original: I'll make some calls.
translated: Je passerai quelques appels.

original: Today is Sunday.
translated: Aujourd'hui c'est dimanche.

original: Keep an eye on it.
translated: Gardez un œil dessus.

original: As soon as work is over, he makes a beeline for the pub.
translated: Dès que le travail est terminé, il se dirige tout droit au pub.

original: This wine is over a year old.
translated: Ce vin a plus d'un an.

original: It's not a big deal.
translated: Ce n'est pas important.

original: You're not married, are you?
translated: Tu n'es pas mariée, si ?

original: I sometimes watch TV.
translated: Je regarde parfois la télévision.

original: I think we're finished here.
translated: Je pense que nous en avons fini ici.

original: We tend to make mistakes.
translated: Nous tendons à nous tromper.

original: The cat is twenty years old.
translated: La chatte a vingt ans.

original: Now that you have come of age, you should know better.
translated: Maintenant que vous êtes adulte, vous devriez être plus avisé.

original: I'm not here.
translated: Je ne suis pas là.

original: Where is this play being performed?
translated: Où est-ce joué ?

original: He is armed to the teeth.
translated: Il est armé jusqu'aux dents.

original: "Will you help me?" "I'll be glad to."
translated: « Pourrais-tu m'aider ? » « J'en serais ravi. »

original: Some people come into your life as blessings, others, as lessons.
translated: Certaines personnes viennent au monde comme des bénédictions, d'autres comme des leçons.
